name: Canyon Lakeview Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This lodge was very nice. Bed was comfortable and great to have a kitchenette. There were also bunk beds and a murphy bed so could have easily accommodated 6. The dry comal creek winery was quaint and had a great wine tasting which was part of our package. The Trattoria nearby has great italian food and shouldn't be missed. Make a reservation!!!! The booking experience for the lodge was very pleasant as well.
reviews.title: Comfortable, nice view and spacious.

reviews.text: My sister and I recently stayed here for 4 nights. We had a great time cooking, fishing, hiking, taking pictures and watching the wildlife in the area. We stayed in Room 5 and it was really nice inside. There is 1 bedroom with a queen size bed and they also had a set of bunk beds. The bathroom is really nice with a great shower. The kitchen has everything that you need for a short stay. Microwave, coffee maker, stove, fridge, oven and pots/pans/dishes. They even include all linens and towels. A very nice stay for sure. The A/C works quite well. They have a long porch with tables/chairs and several porch swings. There are many deer in the area and food is provided for you to feed them. They will come right up onto the porch and eat out of your hand. They also have an area that you can use to grill your meals. You are not too far from the water if you decide to go fishing or just take a swim. We would definitely stay here again. Just far enough from home to think you went somewhere but close enough that it is not a long car ride to get to. Thank you for a wonderful stay!!!
reviews.title: Great Sister Time

reviews.text: My girlfriends take a mystery girls trip every year. This year was my turn and I chose Canyon Lakeview Resort for our surprise. We had the best time. The directions they provided got us there perfectly. We loved the swim cove and especially the hot tub. We went to Guadalupe Canoe Livery for our tubing expedition because it came recommended on the website. We also had Genarro's cater dinner one night, also recommended on the website. Delicious! I look forward to coming back with my family one day.
reviews.title: Girls Weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The resort is a very good, quiet place to stay--the kind my wife and I enjoy most. The views of the lake are great. The amenities are limited: no restaurant, for example. However, feeding of the local deer herd is encouraged, resulting in numerous deer on property most of the time--I think we counted 21 grazing outside our balcony one time.
reviews.title: Confusing to get there, but worth it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Getting to the resort proved a challenge, however, simply because of the confusing street names in the area. Heaven forbid you should find yourself on N or S Scenic Circle when looking for Scenic Drive (the Circles do not touch the Drive) or on Lakeview Drive E when looking for Lakeview Drive (the one is not a continuation of the other. On our third or fourth time to the resort, we began to be able to do it without using our GPS.
reviews.title: Great Anniversary weekend!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the moment we got there on a Friday evening, with an unexpected music duo playing down from our balcony and a soft breeze blowing, we felt all stress float away. This was a lovely and perfect weekend stay--with the lake view, the sweet deer eating out of our hands, the very comfortable bed (I want that pillow), nice accommodations and all the activities of the area, it was just what we were looking for and needing! Great memories! We're thinking about getting a group together for the Fall and staying at the cabins!
reviews.title: Canyon Lakeview

reviews.text: Is it fair to review this place if I didn't even get to stay there?!? I, too, had an awful experience with reservations. I was booking this trip for my mother and I. The date I booked did not work for her, so when I finally got through to reservations (the same day I booked) to change the date, they refused to accommodate me, stating that a change in reservation was the same as canceling (Groupon fine print with their 14 day window). I was just trying to change the reservation and still experience their resort, but they said I was out the money. The manager at Canyon Lake was not flexible at all. Now I'm in a dramatic showdown between Groupon, Canyon Lakeview, and my credit card company to get my money back. Buyer Beware!!
reviews.title: Another bad Groupon with this resort!

reviews.text: So, I bought a groupon for this place- called for a week, couldn't get through. Started emailing and facebooking and finally got a response- they had too many grouponers calling. The whole process of reserving a room took about 3 weeks. I was very flexible with my dates of stay, yet they were still unable to accommodate me (within the tight constraints of the groupon checkin and use by dates) . They told me that I had to spend an additional $100 to get in under their constraints, but I would be given a bigger cabin. I didn't need the bigger cabin, that's why I bought the groupon for the smaller cabin. So I spent the extra money, as I had money invested in it already. The pros on this cabin are that the views are quite lovely, the cabin itself was clean, and the hot tub was nice, and we had a good time feeding the deer. The cons: The reservation process, the extra money spent. The tape over the hole in the couch, the cracked tiles in bathroom and kitchen, the plunging of the toilet every time we used the bathroom(and yes, we only put toilet paper in it) and the leaking ceiling when someone took a shower upstairs. I would certainly not pay the full price of $550 per night to stay here. Maybe I would give a better review, if the whole reservation experience was different.
reviews.title: do not buy a groupon for this place!!!

reviews.text: Also note, the swim cove, wear river shoes- there is no really good place to get into the lake to swim- especially with children-
reviews.title: Lovely cabin located on a beautiful lake

reviews.text: Two families rented a Comal cabin which sleeps ten people. We were in Cabin B. No view of the lake from the bottom deck where the hot tub is located. We were extremely pleased with this place. The cabin was VERY clean and had everything that was needed for a great stay. We were there over the July 4th weekend, so the lake was very busy but the resort was fine. No loud noises except for the fireworks on the lake! Each cabin has its own grill and we used it each night to cook dinner. Cabins C-F have a fire pit located in front of them if you want to do smores. The deer came out and greeted us as soon as we arrived. The kids LOVED this. The resort provides food for them. They are very friendly and hungry! We used the new swimming pool one day and the kids enjoyed it. We walked by the lodge but didn't see the inside of the rooms though. Plenty of room to park the boat by the lodge. We used the hot tub everyday. It seemed very clean upon check in. I noticed them draining one on another cabin deck before we departed, so it seems like they keep them very clean. We had a great stay here and will definitely be back again.
reviews.title: Poor response -

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I used a Groupon and had no issues. Here is why. If you are interested in staying get to the purchase page of Groupon and call the hotel. In this instance it was Canyon Lake. I picked the days I wanted and they were open. I mentioned I'd be using a Groupon and they needed a code. I click on Groupon and in 45 seconds I had the code. All set. I do this WHENEVER I use Groupon. There should be no complaints about Groupn and scheduling if you do the above.
reviews.title: Nice Visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The lodge appears nothing special from the frontage but that is deceptive. The rooms are spacious, clean and with a great view. Each unit has an exterior table to enjoy reading or dining. The kitchen is of open design for a table and a living room. It is also fully applianced.
reviews.title: Great !

reviews.text: We stayed two days and it was primarily for relaxation and exploring the area. .The area is dependent upon recreation and outdoor activities so that is of consideration. Otherwise, stay in Austin or SA.
reviews.title: Awesome quiet getaway!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As far as pricing I would be hesitant to pay rack rate, but this is essentially off season and Groupon, so it was $135 for two nights.
reviews.title: Peaceful,and Relaxing

reviews.text: and will definitely be back. It was so peaceful and quiet. Rooms were immaculate and fully stocked with all the necessary pots, pans and cups. The deer were friendly and deer food provided. Next time I'm staying at a cabin so I can use a hot tub. Thanks for the hospitality!!!
reviews.title: stayed at the resort

reviews.text: Our group of 12 took out the Comal and Guadalupe cabins next to each other so that our kids had plenty of space yet enough privacy for the toddlers' napping. The cabins were exceptionally clean and had many beds (actually more beds than there was storage space for!). We enjoyed the huge open dining, living, and kitchen areas. They have coffee filters, a toaster, electric can opener, slow cooker, trash bags, dishwasher + detergent, plus much more. Comal's dining room sat 6 while Guadalupe's sat 10, but we also used the outdoor tables near the bbq (expect to clean the grill or bring aluminum). There were plenty of clean chairs. The volleyball court was great too. Guadalupe's 2nd floor bath is much larger, and bring shampoo (we prefer to anyway). Take advantage of the proximity to the numerous attractions and walk down to the water. Bonnie, Terry, and Rosemary took great care of us from the booking to the duration of our stay. They even resolved the problem with livingsocial.com, from whom we bought vouchers for the rooms.
reviews.title: Comal & Guadalupe Cabins

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Enjoyed the feeding of the deer. A pretty cat & peacocks were onsite. The room was comfy for us.We found it clean and plenty of linens available. It really is dark in the "Hill Country"; therefore there was plenty of security lights to choose from. I am looking forward in going back.
reviews.title: just loved it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My first trip to Canyon Lake. I didn't know what to expect but, I was looking forward to it because my friends kept telling me the Canyon Lake area is real nice. My stay at Canyon Lakeview Resort was exceptional. I had a second floor suite which gives you a nicer view of the Lake however; There are open Balconies on the property on both levels which means you don't have to have a second floor room to enjoy the view. The room was nicely appointed. Full kitchen, nice Living Room. Living Room has a working Flat Screen TV which picks up regular channels no premium channels such as HBO or Showtime, etc... They do provide a BluRay player which was nice. In the Bedroom we had a TV as well but it was out of order with a sign on the Base of the TV indicating as much.
reviews.title: Wonderful

reviews.text: The room was great and with the exception of the TV in the bedroom, the only other negative is that the room was not equipped with an Iron and Ironing board which could have been useful.
reviews.title: kids really enjoyed it!

description: Beautiful resort right on the water at Canyon Lake. Suites sleep 4 and 6; Cabins sleep 10 and 12. Complete kitchens in every unit. Hot tub and gas grill with each Cabin. Boat Ramp access. Remarkable views from decks and property. Outdoor and indoor event areas. Great for weddings, reunions and retreats! 10 minutes from the popular Guadalupe River. Group rates, partial and entire facility rental available upon request.
